sub_topic: Using the power rule to differentiate functions
message_1: Differentiate the function f(x) = 5x^6 with respect to x using the power rule.
message_2:
To differentiate the function f(x) = 5x^6 with respect to x using the power rule, we apply the rule:

(d/dx)(x^n) = n * x^(n-1)

In this case, n = 6. So, we have:

f'(x) = 6 * 5x^(6-1)

f'(x) = 30x^5
